articles.headline: Fighter Sees His Paradise in Gaza’s Pain
articles.snippet: At Shifa Hospital, ordinary people are squeezed between suicidal fighters and a powerful military.
articles.abstract: At Shifa Hospital, ordinary people are squeezed between suicidal fighters and a powerful military.
articles.lead_paragraph: GAZA CITY  The emergency room in Shifa Hospital is often a place of gore and despair. On Thursday, it was also a lesson in the way ordinary people are squeezed between suicidal fighters and a military behemoth.

articles.headline: Easy Loans Financed Dividends
articles.snippet: From 2004 to 2006, many dividends were as freewheeling as the mortgages given to homeowners with bad credit.
articles.abstract: From 2004 to 2006, many dividends were as freewheeling as the mortgages given to homeowners with bad credit.

articles.headline: Citi Reaches Deal With Lawmakers on Home Loans
articles.snippet: Under the plan, bankruptcy judges will be allowed to alter home loans in an effort to prevent foreclosures.
articles.abstract: Under the plan, bankruptcy judges will be allowed to alter home loans in an effort to prevent foreclosures.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  In a move that would help troubled homeowners, Citigroup agreed to support legislation that would let bankruptcy judges adjust mortgages for at-risk borrowers, leading Congressional Democrats said on Thursday.

articles.headline: Democrats Seek Delay in TV Shift
articles.snippet: The Obama transition team is seeking to delay the Feb. 17 move to digital TV, saying millions of homes aren’t ready.
articles.abstract: The Obama transition team is seeking to delay the Feb. 17 move to digital TV, saying millions of homes aren’t ready.
articles.lead_paragraph: The nation’s broadcasters may not complete their long-awaited switch to all-digital TV next month, after all.

articles.headline: For BlackBerry, Obama’s Devotion Is Priceless
articles.snippet: President-elect Barack Obama has become BlackBerry’s most prominent user, a pitch that would be worth millions if he could charge for it.
articles.abstract: President-elect Barack Obama has become BlackBerry’s most prominent user, a pitch that would be worth millions if he could charge for it.
articles.lead_paragraph: This week, Michael Phelps signed a deal worth more than $1 million to advertise Mazda in China. Jerry Seinfeld earned a reported $10 million to appear in Microsoft’s recent television campaign.

articles.headline: Nationwide Inquiry on Bids for Municipal Bonds
articles.snippet: The authorities have been investigating what appears to be collusion in the multibillion-dollar market.
articles.abstract: The authorities have been investigating what appears to be collusion in the multibillion-dollar market.
articles.lead_paragraph: The federal investigation that prompted Gov. Bill Richardson of New Mexico to withdraw his nomination as commerce secretary offers a rare glimpse into a long-simmering investigation of possible bid-rigging, tax evasion and other wrongdoing throughout the municipal bond business.

articles.headline: Senate Allies Fault Obama on Stimulus
articles.snippet: The president-elect’s economic recovery plan ran into cross-fire from his own party, suggesting that it could take more time to pass than Democrats once hoped.
articles.abstract: The president-elect’s economic recovery plan ran into cross-fire from his own party, suggesting that it could take more time to pass than Democrats once hoped.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  President-elect Barack Obama’s economic recovery plan ran into crossfire from his own party in Congress on Thursday, suggesting that quick passage of spending programs and tax cuts could require more time and negotiation than Democrats once hoped.
articles.byline: By Peter Baker and David M. Herszenhorn

articles.headline: Pressured by I.R.S., UBS Is Closing Secret Accounts
articles.snippet: UBS will close about 19,000 accounts held by Americans that may have gone undeclared to the Internal Revenue Service.
articles.abstract: UBS will close about 19,000 accounts held by Americans that may have gone undeclared to the Internal Revenue Service.
articles.lead_paragraph: Under pressure from federal authorities, the Swiss bank UBS is closing the hidden offshore accounts of its well-heeled American clients, potentially allowing their secrets to spill into the open.

articles.headline: Jobless Rate Hits 7.2%, a 16-Year High
articles.snippet: The economy lost 524,000 jobs in December, bringing the total for 2008 to 2.6 million, and more was expected in months ahead.
articles.abstract: The economy lost 524,000 jobs in December, bringing the total for 2008 to 2.6 million, and more was expected in months ahead.
articles.lead_paragraph: The nation lost 524,000 jobs in December, reflecting a pervasive fear among employers that if they fail to shed workers quickly their companies may go under in a recession poised to become the worst since the 1930s.
